overview_of_class: French 125-2 is the second quarter of the three-quarter Intensive Intermediate French course for students who have completed French 125-1 or have been placed in that course by the French department. The primary goal of this course is to strengthen oral and written communication skills by immersing students in authentic cultural contexts and language. A review of essential grammar will reinforce linguistic foundations. Class meets three times a week and will be conducted in French. To fulfill the WCAS language requirement, students must pass the next course, FR125-3, with a minimum grade of C-.
name: Intensive Intermediate French
title: WCAS FRENCH 125-2-20 Intensive Intermediate French

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: French 125-2 is the second quarter of the three-quarter Intensive Intermediate French course for students who have completed French 125-1 or have been placed in that course by the French department. The primary goal of this course is to strengthen oral and written communication skills by immersing students in authentic cultural contexts and language. A review of essential grammar will reinforce linguistic foundations. Class meets three times a week and will be conducted in French. To fulfill the WCAS language requirement, students must pass the next course, FR125-3, with a minimum grade of C-.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: 125-1 or placement

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value: Develop students speaking, listening, reading and writing skills at the intermediate level of French in a cultural context and foster critical thinking.

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: Through study, exercises, conversation and various class activities, students will review and practice basic grammar, while exploring contemporary French and Francophone cultures. Students are expected to attend class daily, to actively participate and to spend at least 2 hours of work outside of class for each contact hour. P/N not allowed.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Class participation, homework & quizzes, four compositions, four lesson tests and end-of-quarter oral test.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: Réseau : Communication, Intégration, Intersections, 2nd Edition by Jean Marie Schultz and Marie-Paule Tranvouez. You will need the access card for the online workbook MyFrenchLab. The package is available at Norris bookstore.

Attendance at 1st class mandatory
